Reviews.Title: “A bit noisy but so practical!”
Reviews.Author: Lyncroft
Reviews.Content: This hostal is a small family business. Situated on the 2nd floor (no elevator), on a side street, it is barely 2 minutes away from Puerta del Sol and its metro station. Reservation by internet (in English) is possible; I received my answer within 24 hours for a single room without bathroom (their cheapest at 25 euros/night). On arrival, I was given my keys (room & front door), shown to my small (but comfortable) room very politely and indicated the bathroom and shower (further down the hall) as well as the living room where one could use a computer (a bit slow) free of charge during the day. My room, very clean, consisted of the usual: bed, table, cupboard, sink. It was right on the street and proved to be somewhat noisy until 11-12 p.m (earplugs are a must) and, in the morning, deliveries took place starting at 6 a.m. The two windows that opened on the small balconies (a bit dirty) had heavy doors to shut off the noise from the two squares nearby. Soap and shampoo as well as towels were provided and the last were changed daily during my stay. Beside the mirror over the sink, there was a blow-dryer. In addition, the room boasted of a small t.v. and a fan. The bed was a tad hard and the pillow a bit on the thin side but that is a matter of preference. The place turned out to be very convenient for visiting the city. Most sites were withing walkable distance (5-20 minutes). At the Mercado San Miguel, 5-minutes walk away, one could buy different kind of tapas and a glass of wine for supper. Note that there is a supermarket in the basement of the main Cortès Inglès on Puerta del Sol.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and friendly atmosphere plus great location! What a great little find!”
Reviews.Author: Victor9123
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on tripadvisor we decided to stay at this hostel for a short trip to Madrid. We contacted the hostel who were very friendly, helpful and replied straight away. As soon as we arrived we were greeted by the friendly staff and shown to our room, which was spotless and cleaned daily. Even though the room was small there was enough space and even an extra bed in the room. There was airconditioning, TV and a beautiful view from the balcony. The bathroom was again very clean and we were provided with fresh clean towels every day. The hostel is in a great location, right near the Plaza Mayor and Puerta De Sol. This is a great find and I definitely recommend a stay here! Plus free Wifi!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent central location”
Reviews.Author: Vicki T
Reviews.Content: The staff were excellent - really friendly and did a superb job of keeping the whole place spotless. The location is unbeatable - right in the heart of things and a stones throw from Sol metro station. Rooms were on the small side, but really comfortable. The only negative was the noise! Due to the very central location, noise is inevitable. I had a street facing room and it was noisy enough to disrupt my sleep. But I guess that's the price you pay for being incredibly central.

Reviews.Title: “tiny but great location”
Reviews.Author: cinzanino
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after reading reviews on tripadvisor - and they were mostly right: it's very small but for the price and location a really great discovery! the staff were very helpful and I could leave my suitcase till it was time to go to the airport. there is not much heating in the rooms so take slippers! i expected it to be much noisier than it was - but with the windows and shutters closed it was fine. and again - the location is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location and solid room/bed!”
Reviews.Author: OregonJerry
Reviews.Content: Such a deal...location between Puerto del Sol and Plaza Mayor. Room is spartan but solid bed and fine. And for $33 / day a real steal!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Sarah0506
Reviews.Content: Really basic and very small rooms but very very clean and would definately stay there again. Really good location, only about 20 seconds walk from puerto del sol. Staff really helpful and as we were not leaving for the airport until 1600 hours they kept our cases until then so we could still chill out in the city. The maps you see are very deceiving and it appears that it is further away than it is but it really isn't. When you come out of the metro (at SOL) look towards Mcdonalds and then walk up the road to the right hand side of McDonalds (Calle Esperatos) about 50 metres and it is on the right (really small sign you will miss it). There are 2 flights of stairs to go up but well worth it. If I went to Madrid again (and I do think that it is highly likely) I will definately stay at Hostal Comercial.

Reviews.Title: “5 wonderful nights in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Marco M
Reviews.Content: I spent a perfect vacation in Madrid thanks to Hostal Comercial and his perfect service. A kind lady took care on our accomodation , very clean place, a confortable room to spend few days in Madrid. A perfect position , in the center of the city, between Plaza Major and Plaza del Sol . They offer a free Wi-fi , i never used it , maybe doesn't work the password ,nevermind I wasn't in Madrid to use wi-fi in the room indeed. Besides You could use for free a Pc in the hall, everyday from 9.30 until 21,30, this is was useful. Thanks!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Werner & Susie
Reviews.Content: Can't fault it, good value, very clean, very friendly and superb location

Reviews.Title: “All about cost”
Reviews.Author: celsocg87
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hostal right in the heart of Madrid. For around 50 Euros per night, you'll get a double room, with air conditioning, tv, wireless internet, bathroom and pretty clean and comphy bed. It's all about cost. The location simply can't be better. The hostal is half a minute walk from Puerta del Sol and 2 minute walk from Plaza Mayor. On top of that, the owners are very nice people who will help you with anything you need. As for breakfast, just go down to the street and cross to the other side. 20 meters down the street there's a place called demontaditos, where you can grab a great breakfast for a very good price. There is some noise thought the night (nothing that will keep you awake) and the bathroom is pretty simple but it will do the job. For the price, it's a really good option.

Reviews.Title: “A great base for a short trip !”
Reviews.Author: manorpark
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend last week and found the location was excellent for getting around Madrid. As had been said in other reviews the rooms are small but are clean and adequate for a short stay, the cost was very reasonable and overall this Hostal is good value and we had no complaints at all. It even had free WiFi but the connection speeds are a bit hit and miss. MP

Reviews.Title: “central and very clean location at bargain price”
Reviews.Author: ElleLaJolla
Reviews.Content: This popular little hostal is located in the heart of old Madrid, very close to the Puerta del Sol and the Plaza Mayor and to many outdoor cafes and restaurants. Be prepared to carry your suitcases up two flights of stairs to get to the tiny lobby. There is no elevator (as of yet). The husband and wife who run the hostal are very sweet and helpful, but speak only Spanish. While we were there, all rooms were booked, and they had to turn away a number of travelers looking for an inexpensive place to stay. This friendly mom-and-pop hostal reminds me of the pensions or guest houses in France and Portugal. The room we had was tiny and cozy but the space was used efficiently, the twin beds were comfortable, the bathroom had a small bathtub/shower and good towels. There was a small flat screen TV, but I could not figure out how to make it work. Most importantly, everything was very clean and there was no smoking allowed. There was an old computer in the lobby with a very temperamental keyboard and slow (but free) internet access but no printer. There are some locuterios nearby where one can use the internet or make phone calls. As expected in this very central location, noise is a big problem. The room looked out over a side street with lots of foot traffic that did not stop until 2 or 3 a.m. Sounds of people walking and talking echoed through the streets. Stores and restaurants shuttering their metal roll-down doors added to this noise. Trash trucks came around 4 am, and building renovation workers began very early (around 6 a.m.). The walls were thin and I could hear other guests talking and more ; ) Definitely bring your ear plugs. All in all, I would recommend this place to budget-minded travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: Tiayolanda
Reviews.Content: I love this little place. Emphasis on LITTLE! The twin bed room was tiny but had it all. But the reason I love this little place is Don Paco and his wife make you feel as though you are staying with them in their home. Don Paco and I had to correspond by e-mail several weeks prior to our arrival. He was always helpful and cordial. He is trying to get an elevator put in. Only 1 floor to climb. He is having trouble getting permits and such. The location is a little noisy but I would stay there in a heartbeat. Computer is slow, old but free. Besides...there are always earplugs for the noise!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, no stress at all”
Reviews.Author: felipecao
Reviews.Content: This is more like a family pension, a very quiet place, the lady that runs the place didn't talk much but was a very correct person, gave us the keys, received the payment in advance and no stress during the whole stay. The room size was ok, but it was very clean. All the other guests were very quiet, we had a very nice time at the hostal. The location is excellent, nearby Plaza del Sol, we were able to get to every point of interest on foot (except for Santiago Bernabeu, which is far from downtown).

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Opinion”
Reviews.Author: Purrpuss
Reviews.Content: I booked my room back in December 2009 for 2 nights 23-25 June and 5 nights 2-7 July and received email confirmation, however when I arrived found I had only been booked in for 23-25. It was a very nice room despite a lot of street noise. For the period 2-7 July I had requested a room with a shower. I was peomised there would be a room when I returned but found it didn't have a shower and was very small, basically a narrow wedge with just enough room for bed and wardrobe. I was in this two nights then transferred to a room with a shower. This wasn't a good move as the shower was literally in the room, about 18" from the side of the bed and the room was no larger than the one I'd had the previous two nights. On the positive side, this room had air-con and this meant I could close both sets of shutters which cut down on street noise considerably. On the positive side, the hostal was kept immaculately clean, the owners were very friendly and apologetic for the mix up and it is centrally positioned, albeit in a very noisy thoroughfare. Partying ends about 1am, street cleaners arrive about 5am and that's on a quiet night. Other nights police decide to use it as a short cut.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very small room”
Reviews.Author: maryo7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights in May. The hotel is on the 2nd floor and is family-run. It helps to know some Spanish, as the owner does not speak much English. The location of this hotel is amazing, on a quiet street just off the Puerta del Sol and very close to Plaza Mayor. There is no elevator. The room was very small with a tiny bathroom. For 50 euro/night it was a great value, but there were also no frills. If you are looking for great location and great value, this is it. If you want 5 star accomodations, keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money at its best”
Reviews.Author: Tanumz
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. Friendly owner and damn cheap. Rooms were tiny but just fine for dropping off tired of walking around, We hardly used public transport everything is so close. No lift. If you look for a fancy place, look elsewhere. This is a no nonsense excellent small hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: Arehiril
Reviews.Content: Very cosy and quiet; beautiful rooms, equipped with all you need. Excellent location - halfway between Plaza Mayor (Main Square) and Puerta del Sol (less then 3 minutes of walk to each). And all this for an unbelievable price! The best hostel I've ever stayed at. Oh, and computer with free access to the internet; basically unlimited (though you had to mind other people, of course).
